page.title: 03Cowbridge Half Marathon
page.content: Ian Beard who was the first man to complete the course said that the course was tough. Paul Prosser who won the first under 16 award this year came in at 1hr 30mins and 6secs. Corris Thomas who is an ex-rugby union international referee came in after 1hr 31mins. Paul Morgan who is a pupil at Y Bont Faen School was one of the youngest who entered came in at 2hrs. All of the people who entered enjoyed the marathon, although they had to pay Â£2:00 to enter which went to the fire brigade and the famine relief of Ethiopia. The competitors followed this course: The fire station (start/finish), down St.Mary Church Road, turned right at Eglwys Brewis, under the bridge at Llanmaes, past Llandow warehouses and up to the fire station at Druids Green, Cowbridge. { Natalie Wilcox and Sarah Williams.
